intro: Marginaria thysanolepis, commonly known as the hairy marginaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Marginaria thysanolepis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
